Name: Chevré, Mr. Paul Romaine Marie Léonce
Hogg, Mr. George Alfred
Remarks: wanted to turn back to pick up passengers in the water but was shouted down by the boat's occupants

Name: Jewell, Mr. Archie
Remarks: survived the sinking of the Titanic and sister ship HMHS Britannic, died during the sinking of SS Donegal in WW1, part of three sinkings

Name: Nourney, Mr. Alfred
Remarks: traveling under the pseudonym Baron Alfred von Drachstedt, originally owned a second class ticket, upgraded

Name: Gibson, Miss. Dorothy Winifred
Remarks: starring in the first movie about the disaster, Nazi sympathizer, alleged intelligence operative, her father died young

Name: Hays, Miss. Margaret Bechstein
Remarks: pomeranian "Bebe" on lifeboat, cared for two Titanic Orphans

Name: Gibson, Mrs. Pauline Caroline
Profession: wife of an advertising salesman and publisher

Name: Bishop, Mrs. Helen
Remarks: had a poodle named Freu Freu she had to leave back in the cabin, she dreamed about him looking out the window while she left

Name: Taylor, Mrs. Juliet Cummins
Remarks: apparently boat 5 the most likely option. husband and wife were lowered in the same boat. boat 7 is already full.

Name: Sloper, Mr. William Thompson
Remarks: falsely accused of dressing as a woman

Name: Bishop, Mr. Dickinson H.
Remarks: falsely accused of dressing as a woman

Name: Seward, Mr. Frederic Kimber
Remarks: hot shot lawyer in new york

Name: Tucker, Mr. Gilbert Milligan jr
Remarks: admirer of Margaret Heys and remained friends with her

Name: Taylor, Mr. Elmer Zebley
Remarks: apparently boat 5 the most likely option. boat 7 is already full.

Name: Dodge, Master. Washington
Profession: Times Magazine financial editor, investor, vice president of stockbrokers Clark, Dodge & Co
Remarks: first child to board a lifeboat

Name: Daniel, Mr. Robert Williams
Remarks: his accounts don't seem logical (him swimming in water for hours), he was apparently cold so Mrs. Dodge put a blanked around him. She was first in boat 5 and was later transferred to boat 7.

Name: Rescue Time (Carpathia)
Age: one of the first boats to be picked up
